alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Scott County; Clark; Conway; Hot Spring; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Ouachita; Perry; Pike; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 24 at 2:14PM CDT until June 25 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For today, heat index values up to 108. For tomorrow, heat index values up to 110 expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, southwest and western Arkansas. * WHEN...For today, until 8 PM CDT. For tomorrow, from 10 AM to 8 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
